summary: Create a Tambola (Housie) number generator app.
architectural_notes: Reset/New Game actions should prompt a Yes/No confirmation modal to prevent accidental game state loss.

existing_features.title: Create the Tambola number generator core flow: initialize a new game containing numbers 1–90, allow drawing the next random uncalled number, and ensure each number is drawn at most once per game.

Build the main UI for gameplay with: (a) a prominent display of the most recently drawn number, (b) a visual 1–90 board/grid that highlights called numbers, and (c) a chronological history list of called numbers.
Add game controls: “New Game/Reset”, “Undo Last Draw”, and an optional “Auto Draw” mode with a user-selectable interval (e.g., 1–10 seconds) that can be started/stopped.
Persist the current game state (called numbers, remaining pool/order, auto-draw settings) in the browser so a page refresh can restore the ongoing game.
Apply a consistent, creative visual theme across the app (colors, typography, spacing, and components) appropriate for a fun game-night tool; keep it responsive for mobile and desktop.

Add generated static images to the frontend and use them in the UI (e.g., app icon / header mark and a subtle background pattern). Store these assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend (not via the backend).
Update the Call History list UI to display the most recently called number first (reverse chronological order), without changing the underlying game state order used for gameplay/undo logic.
Update the main gameplay layout to swap the on-screen positions of the Number Board and the Call History panel, keeping the layout responsive for mobile and desktop.
Add a new "Quick Reset" control to the gameplay controls area alongside existing buttons.
Show a confirmation popup (Yes/No) whenever the user triggers either Quick Reset or New Game, and only proceed with the action when the user confirms "Yes".

Implement distinct handlers for Quick Reset vs New Game so that: (a) Quick Reset resets the game numbers state (called numbers, remaining pool, last drawn, completion) and stops auto-draw if running, while preserving the current auto-draw interval setting; (b) New Game performs a full reset including returning auto-draw settings (enabled + interval) to their defaults.
